729600f-b.title: Richmond: St. Pauls Avenue - Clinton Street
729600f-b.text:
(1)
225 St. Pauls Avenue, south of the S.E. corner of Clinton
Street, showing St. Pauls Protestant Episcopal Wemorial Church.
The building was erected in 1868.
May 28, 1927
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
The parsonage of St. Pauls Memorial Church, adjoining the
church to the south.
May 28, 1927
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

729603f-a.title: Richmond: St. Pauls Avenue - Paxton Street
729603f-a.text:
St. Pauls Avenue, adjoining the N. W. corner of
Paxton (Church) Street, showing the old St. Pauls (P.E.)
Memorial Whurch. The building was erected in 1834. A new
brick edifice was ereeted in 18o6 at the S. E. corner of
St. Pauls avenue and Clinton Street, and the old structure
abandoned.
187O's (7)
Copy from photorraph by J. Loeffler
From P. L. Sperr Collection
NO PEPODUCTI.NS
